en.definition: car

en.commentary: This word is deprecated by the creator, replaced by "natu".
en.definition: cross-like shape, intersection, overlap [alternative form of natu]

en.commentary: Virtually unknown outside the Korean toki pona community.
en.definition: (interjection) [general interjection, context-dependent]
en.sp_etymology: exclamation radical + Hangul syllable 아 (a); radical from exclamation point (!), without the full stop at the bottom. compare a, o

en.definition: shocking, surprising, unexpected; sour, bitter, acidic

en.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
en.definition: the set of concepts expressed by established toki pona words, subtracted from the set of every possible concept, such that every concept not already expressed by an existing toki pona word is expressed
(particle) [placed after the main sentence, introducing a context phrase]
oil, fat, grease; slippery; salty, savory

en.commentary: jan Lenoka further elaborated the semantics to imply "to bump into, to make contact with".
en.definition: bump, knock, jolt

en.commentary: It is recommended to use "natu" instead.
en.definition: cross-like shape, intersection, overlap [alternative form of natu]

eliki.author_verbatim: <:nimisin:743741432350769152> **eliki** - distress, affliction, adversity, pain <- Tsalagi *ehisdi* ‘pain, distress’
creator: kala suno pi kulupu telo mun

en.commentary: an experience with the quality of being deeply felt or important to oneself while defying classification as positive, negative, or a simply described admixture of positive and negative
en.definition: trial, adversity; bittersweet; an experience with the quality of being deeply felt or important to oneself while defying classification as positive, negative, or a simply described admixture of positive and negative

en.commentary:
Considered deprecated by the author: "mi pali e nimi enko a a
open la pilin mi li sama
nimi enko li pona, jan mute o kepeken
taso kepeken pi toki pona la mi kama sona
nimi ante li ken toki e wile toki pi nimi enko
la ona li suli ala"
en.definition: (spatial equivalents of tenpo constructions) space, place, distance, size (length, width, height, depth, area, volume)
beyond, exceeding, outside of, more than
stone, gravel, rock, pebble, lava, magma

en.commentary: In a poll in 2002, "i" was proposed as a replacement for the now-archaic third-person pronoun "iki". However, it failed to get enough votes.
en.definition: he, she, it, they [polled as a replacement third-person pronoun in 2002]

en.commentary: In a poll in 2002, "iki" was deemed too similar to "ike" and replaced by "ona".
en.definition: he, she, it, they [third-person pronoun in 2002, replaced by ona in a poll]

etymology.definition: (third-person singular masculine, feminine, and gender neutral pronoun)

en.commentary: A particle that allows the speaker to specify the level of information they have about a situation. As a modifier, it means "at least" or "definitely", indicating knowledge of one thing but not necessarily other things.
en.definition: at least, definitely; still, yet, even

en.commentary: In a poll in 2002, "ipi" was proposed as a replacement for the now-archaic third-person pronoun "iki". However, it failed to get enough votes.
en.definition: he, she, it, they [polled as a replacement third-person pronoun in 2002]

en.commentary: Intended as an alt for namako that removes the "additional, extra" definition. used to emphasize that these details are core to something, and not superfluous.
en.definition: flower; adornment, accessory, garnish, spice; ornamental, aesthetic, beauty, flourish

en.commentary: Coined in reference to the song ‘Mia Khalifa’ by iLOVEFRiDay, where "hit or miss" was a prominent lyric. Sources disagree on who coined the word.
en.definition: Schadenfreude, indirect insult, disrespect, shade
(number) one hundred

en.commentary: In a poll in 2002, "jalan" was proposed as a replacement for "noka". However, it failed to get enough votes.
en.definition: foot, leg [polled as a replacement for noka in 2002]

en.commentary: Not coined directly, but developed out of repeated use in the early ma pona pi toki pona Discord server community. jans was repeatedly used because of the humor in adding an English plural suffix to a Toki Pona word.
en.definition: a particular group of early members of the ma pona pi toki pona Discord server
(interjection) [indicating excitement]
(word reserved for future use by Sonja Lang)
indeterminate, inconclusive, tentative; unpredictable, unstable, volatile; to waver; to vibrate, to tremble, to wobble, to shake

jume.author_verbatim: isipin is kinda dumb so here's a better nimisin: jume, dream
creator: jan Seli

en.commentary: Experimental, to see how the meaning could be expanded, but never actually used. No set of meanings was ever settled on before stopping the experiment, but one potential meaning the creator particularly liked was "fantasy" or "unreality", without a negative connotation.
en.definition: dream
(pirate noise)

kalijopilale.author_verbatim: member of the order Caryophyllales, including all cacti as well as carnations, beets, and many carnivorous plants
creator: jan Likipi

en.definition: member of the order Caryophyllales, including all cacti as well as carnations, beets, and many carnivorous plants
(preposition) with, among, in the company of

en.commentary: Serves as a non-deprecated, neutral-connotation, and polysemous variant of words like oni, powe, or jume.
en.definition: dream; trance, hypnosis, hallucination; illusion, fantasy, imaginary; narrative, story, myth

en.commentary: In a poll in 2002, "kapa" was proposed as a replacement for "nena". However, it failed to get enough votes.
en.definition: extrusion, protrusion, hill, mountain, button [polled as a replacement for nena in 2002]
(acknowledgement or acceptance)

en.commentary: Coined as a shortened version of kepeken by jan Tomen in 2017. Did not see significant use until 2020.
en.definition: [shortened variant of kepeken]

etymology.definition: to use, by means of, with

kese.author_verbatim: basically a wider version of tonsi, if you're not already using tonsi to mean LGBT+ in general
creator: jan Jan

en.definition: queer, LGBT+

etymology.definition: named for the Jewish LGBT organization Keshet

en.definition: (particle) [relative clause marker]
cat

en.commentary: Virtually unknown outside the Korean toki pona community. Apparently used humorously.
en.definition: to notify, to let know
guard, protect, defend, shield, brace, fortify from outside
[shortened variant of kulupu]; six (particularly in seximal base)
laughter, chuckle, laugh, comedy, humor

etymology.definition: 'fun sound from the mouth', to sing with your voice

etymology.word: kulupu pi toki pona pi ma Anku

en.commentary: Virtually unknown outside the Korean toki pona community.
en.definition: the Korean group chat "kulupu pi toki pona pi ma Anku"

etymology.definition: the Toki Pona community of Korea

en.sp_etymology: kulupu, with the bottom-left circle being the composite glyph for toki pona, and the bottom-right circle being a Taegeuk as on the flag of South Korea

en.commentary: Virtually unknown outside the Korean toki pona community.
en.definition: to agree with laughter
collection, assortment, menagerie, arrangement, handful, harvest; seven

en.commentary: Previously known as lu. Most of those interested in the word have agreed to change it to lo, to avoid interfering with the reserved word.
en.definition: (particle) [indicates a prepositional phrase]

en.commentary: Coined in response to jan Sonja's survey, as a portmanteau, presumably as a joke.
en.definition: limb e.g. arm, leg

etymology.definition: hand, arm, grasping appendage, tactile appendage

en.definition: [word made as a compromise between "lukin" and "oko"]
(word reserved for future use by Sonja Lang)

molusa.author_verbatim: hm i am considering making a nimisin for mollusks, if that isn’t already a thing
creator: jan soweli Apen

en.definition: squishy animal, e.g., snail, slug, sponge

etymology.definition: Invertebrae related to snails, slugs, mussels, octopi (scientific nomenclature)

en.definition: orange (color)
relationship, correlation, commonality; cross, knot, junction, intersection; to overlap, to fold; to overstep, to exceed to a point
(number) four

en.commentary: Meant to be antonymous to the 'cover, layer of privacy' meanings of 'len'. It can be applied both literally and metaphorically.
en.definition: transparent material/object, lack of privacy; clear, transparent, unobstructed; to make clear, to make transparent, to remove obstructions

etymology.definition: cloth, fabric, clothing; secret, hidden, covered

en.commentary: Intended as an alt to esun which implies that non-mutually-beneficial relationships are not real relationships.
en.definition: connected, related, joined; complementary, mutual; exchange

etymology.definition: to join, to add, to unite, to connect; to continue, to carry on, to perpetuate

en.definition: (word reserved for future use by Sonja Lang)
boomer, Baby Boomer, inconsiderate elder; [interjection/insult]

en.commentary: Though it may have many possible origins, it was first coined in a small group chat. It is mostly used as a variant of the toki pona words "oke" and "ke"
en.definition: (acknowledgement or acceptance)
(proper name) a song by jan Usawi, (literally) "eat a bad fish"

etymology.definition: 'eat a bad fish', wishing somebody harm instead of well
'eat a good fish', wishing somebody well

en.definition: sarcasm, irony

etymology.definition: 'kill me', express exasperation or frustration sarcastically

en.commentary:
This word is deprecated by the creator; it is considered part of the "toki oni" tokiponido instead.
The pronunciation of the second syllable was due to personal preferences of the creator, not modern Greek.
en.definition: dream, daydream, imaginative play, vision, mystical state; to entrance
(interjection) bruh; expression of disbelief, exasperation, or excitement
[misspelling of pakala]
good, easy; simple, relaxed, peaceful, uncomplicated
sibling, brother, sister

etymology.definition: sibling or cousin of the same gender

en.definition: green, greenish; verdant, alive; ecofriendly

en.commentary: This word is deprecated by the creator.
en.definition: cry, tears; sad, sadness
annoy, annoyance, bothersome, boring

polinpin.author_verbatim:
Noun
•Bowling pin
Adjective
•Bowling pin like
Verb
•To be a Bowling pin
creator: jan Kisinja

en.definition: bowling pin

en.commentary: From the time management method developed by Francesco Cirillo in Berlin in the 1980s, for which people often used tomato-shaped timers. In ku, "pomotolo" was given as one of the translations of "tomato", presumably due to speakers misusing or misunderstanding the word.
en.definition: effective, useful, give good results

en.commentary: Occasionally comes up as a jokish corruption of "pona" (especially in a phrase "toki poni").
en.definition: pony (of or relating to the My Little Pony franchise)

en.commentary: Coined in reference to jan Samu, a Facebook user who attempted to propose a new word.
en.definition: wanting to create new words

en.commentary: Coined in reference to the Travis Scott song ‘Sicko Mode’.
en.definition: on a higher tier/plane, enlighten(ed), epic; to an exceedingly great extent

sipi.author_verbatim: I thought of another word which would mean the "ego", "self", "own",because Toki Pona doesn't have reflexive voice and pronoun like inthe sentences "he's watching himself (and not somebody else)" or "Hetake his own(not her) hand". I called it "sipi" (as it is "sibi" inLatin). Then it would be "ona li lukin e sipi (pi ona)" (he watcheshis ego) and "ona li jo e luka sipi (pi ona)" (he takes his ego'shand). It would also be used to compound words like "egoism"(nasin/pilin sipi) and so on...What do you think?
creator: spad0103

en.commentary: Proposed on a forum and quickly forgotten. Notable only for being an early non pu word proposal.
en.definition: ego, self, own
[humorous synonym of lape]

en.commentary: May refer to a state prior to a kama.
en.definition: pattern, constant, unchanged, unaltered, unaffected; instinct, habit, to use to, to tend to

etymology.definition: to use to, to tend to

en.commentary: The typo was made by jan Sonja while writing ku. The absolute majority of the community does not treat it as a newly coined word.
en.definition: [typo of sike]

en.commentary: Follows a semantically consistent pattern of "SUBJ li PV ta PRED" = "SUBJ li PV e [SUBJ li PRED]" or "[SUBJ li PRED] li PV". The top and bottom lines of the sitelen pona may be extended to the left around the pre-predicate word(s).
en.definition: (particle) [marks the previous words as preverbs]

en.commentary: Out of use.
en.definition: [shortened variant of tenpo]
focus, attention, concentrate, resolution, fineness; focus on

en.commentary: The typo was made by jan Sonja while writing ku. The absolute majority of the community does not treat it as a newly coined word.
en.definition: [typo of tomo]
(number) three
(word reserved for future use by Sonja Lang)

umesu.author_verbatim: to amaze people by being on top of the musi Ako leaderboard
creator: jan Wija

en.commentary: Created for the game Acrophobia (musi Ako) in response to the fact that there are few words starting with 'u' in Toki Pona.
en.definition: amaze people by being on the top of the leaderboard of a toki pona game

en.commentary: May be used as a preposition, e.g. "lipu waleja toki pona = a book about toki pona". However, this usage is very rare.
en.definition: context, topic, salience, pertinent, topical, pertain to, be relevant

wawajete.author_verbatim:
•Something that appears to break the rules but doesn't
•Faux edginess
•Provocation
creator: jan Tolin

en.commentary: Coined in reference to wuwojiti, a sequence of all phonotactically unviable CV syllables in toki pona.
en.definition: something that appears to break the rules but doesn't; faux edginess, provocation

etymology.definition: (all the phonotactically unviable CV syllables in Toki Pona)

en.definition: guy, pal, friend, buddy

en.commentary: Out of use.
en.definition: (acts as a transition from one complete sentence to another)
(pronoun) we (excluding you)

en.commentary: The "y" was a typo and was meant to be "j", but got kept in anyway; compare "yupekosi".
en.definition: the star emoji used for the starboard #pona-kulupu in the ma pona pi toki pona Discord server
